intro: Sebaea debilis, commonly known as the weak sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and compact size. Sebaea debilis prefers well-drained soil and moderate sunlight, making it suitable for both indoor and outdoor gardens.
